Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice renovation but let down by the details”
Reviews.Author: Rod V
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently while overnighting in London. Hotel has been recently refurbished and is clean and tidy. Also relatively cheap by London standrads. Unfortunately it is let down by the details. The Hotel was hard to spot while driving because they only had a laminated sheet with their name on the front door. The room was OK. Neat and clean but fairly sparse. The bathroom was tiny!. I had trouble fitting into the shower alcove and if I dropped the soap I had to open the door to be able to bend down to retrieve it. And worst of all the water temperature was erratic and impossible to regulate. It went from boiling hot to freezing cold with only a minor adjustment of the control. And that is really frustrating and, in fact painful, when in a shower alcove that is so small. I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “NO SOUND PROOFING!”
Reviews.Author: Jemma N
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean (I didn't see anything like as bad as the photos on here) and I was expecting it really to be passable. But... Please, if you want to get any sleep whatsoever, please go somwhere else! There is absolutely no sound proofing and the walls must be made of cereal boxes. You could literally hear other guests' phones ringing AND vibrating in their rooms. You could hear every word of conversations carried out in other rooms( I had to ask two ladies in the next room to try and speak a bit quieter at about 5:30 although they were by no means speaking loudly), you could even hear people in other rooms turning over in their (extraordinarily creaky) beds. I could hear a guy snoring on the other side of the corridor two doors up and if anybody walked down the corridors the floor creaked so much it sounded like it was going to go through. It's an ok place, the beds were ok, typical economy hotel pillows were like sheets of A4 placed on the bed and you have to trek out of the back door and across a car park to get to breakfast in the morning. This I could have coped with if I had got a wink of sleep during the night. Sound proofing is not a dirty word!

Reviews.Title: “All gud”
Reviews.Author: zowlar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we went to watch stoke f.c, the staff were friendly and allowed us to use the car park when we went the match, the rm was clean and tidy, the staff were friendly and we'd go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It!”
Reviews.Author: acantwell72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 9 nights in October 2011 with my boyfriend. The place is a dump! Don't let the pretty pictures on the website fool you! We were in the "Queens Wing" of the motel. This is a section that has not been remodeled. Our first rooms bathroom was filthy! Covered in mold and mildew, and smelled like urine. My boyfriend went to the front desk to see about a different room; the male receptionist was insanely rude, accusing my BF of being drunk (not so) and threatening to call the police! We were given the option to change rooms, which we did, but the 2nd was no better. The T.V didn't really work, the shower head was cracked so the water gushed out like a garden hose. The window was stuck half way open, wouldn't close. The main entrance door lock was screwed up, sometimes it took 10 minutes of jiggling it to enter the building. The electrical outlets in the room only worked occasionaly. The guest towels were stored on the nasty floor in the hall downstairs. They wanted guest to leave their room key at the front desk each time you left the hotel! Once again, do not let the website pics fool you...the front of the hotel doesn't even look like the web pic! The only positive point of the motel is its location. Easy walk to tube, buses, train. Plenty of shopping, restaurants, pubs, etc. It was easy to get to and from Heathrow as well.

Reviews.Title: “gaustly”
Reviews.Author: BMM47_11
Reviews.Content: Arrived 2.30pm after checking in was directed through car park to other hotel reception and given the keys to a room in yet another building across the street. We found on opening the door that the room had not yet been cleaned from previous occupants, it was a family room (we booked a double room), we left our suitcase and went out. On our return found that the room still reeked of smoke and the curtains were hanging off the rail My husband climbed on a chest to hook them up so we could close them. In the hallway out side our room the carpet was filthy a cigarette end that was there on arrival was still there on departure. Don't stay there its disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Still being renovated!”
Reviews.Author: Dragley51
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Hotel named above we were greeted by a building site with signage in the windows stating business as usual! After registering at reception we were confronted by the ominous Lift Out of Order sign. The Hotel was being renovated and in my opinion should not have been allowed to function as a working business until the rooms had been in a fit condition for guests! After my stay at the above Hotel I feel compelled to write of the appalling condition of my room! The wardrobe was falling apart and the telephone was taped up to stop it disintegrating and was of a severely soiled appearance - it had no electrical safety check label, unlike the television and kettle. The bed was missing a rail from the foot board and wobbled . There was no plug for the sink or bath and the mixer taps over the bath had rust and mould around them - as did the surrounding tile work. The mixer tap design prevented a shower being possible, as it was either cold or too hot . To add further misery on our first morning there was no hot water available until later that day as the boiler was out of action. Breakfast we discovered was being served in another adjacent property - The Central Park belonging to the company The coin operated PC in the Central Park reception area did not work. An unhelpful sign stated that the hotel was not responsible for the machine despite wasting my time as I simply could not get on the web. All £1 gave me was nine minutes of frustration! The Hotel web site was very miss leading

Reviews.Title: “Things have vastly improved”
Reviews.Author: stillwelltravelled
Reviews.Content: I see that many people have made some very negative comments about this place, (probably with good reason when they were made) I actually read the reviews AFTER booking and was horrified by what I read, so I was pleasantly surprised with my newly-refurbished room, tea making facilities, new furnishings and drapes, its proximity to the tube station (about 100 metres) and an adequate, if basic breakfast of toast, cheese, ham, coffee and juice. Carparking was included in the price, an added bonus. Would I stay there again,? yes I would.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here under any circumstances.”
Reviews.Author: an0n2000
Reviews.Content: Room disgusting, damp, mouldy bathroom. TV didn't work. Fire alarm going off at 12 midnight, they didn't evacuate or follow any fire procedres, just silenced the alarm. Ground floor room, had people banging on the window. Left hotel in early hours to find alternative accomodation as a female travelling alone, I didn't feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Fiver75
Reviews.Content: It was a pretty bad start when I had to ask a tradesman out the front of the hotel if this was the Pembury – they were under renovation when I stayed there and had simply taken down all their signage! Staff seemed decent and I was checked in quickly. Before I go on, I should say that the staff I dealt with were good – they actually smiled and said g’day, which is more than I have experienced in some other London hotels. The ‘functioning ‘ part of the hotel was in disarray. Dirty and very worn. The room was a shocker. It was tiny – so small I had to twist sideways to get between the wall and the wardrobe! That I could handle, though. The floorboards and both in the room and in the hall outside were creaky and noisy as heck. I could almost handle that too. The real problem was that the room was filthy! The carpet looked like it was brushed, not vacuumed. The walls were stained. The bathroom was a real cess-pit; the shower fittings had rusted and were just left there, the sink was corroded and I found a toe-nail clipping on the floor. As I said, I can handle a few issues with a hotel, I’m certainly not fussy, but when things are so dirty that it makes my skin crawl, something is very wrong. A couple of other little things annoyed me. The blinds were not long enough to cover the window, and likewise the shower curtain. Indeed, with the calcified shower head spraying water in all directions, it was difficult to take a shower without covering the whole bathroom in water. Maybe once the renovations are complete, the Pembury might be a hotel worth visiting. But for now, it is disgraceful that they are charging (decent) money to stay in such run-down, uncared for rooms. Terrible!

Reviews.Title: “We Hated it and we won't be Back”
Reviews.Author: ST3PH3N8888
Reviews.Content: We arrived in London and had a business conference in the morning till around 1500hours.. After the conference myself and my boss went ahead to Finsbury Park to sort all of the hotel arrangements out as we had two guests also with us. When we arrived at the hotel we went to the receptioin and asked for our booking. We were told there was no such booking even though the receptionist had the paper work in his hand which stated differently. He told us that our room wasnt available as the "computer" had over booked our room so they had made plans to put us all into a quad room which we were not happy about having both male and female in the same room. so we asked them what they were willing to do and with a shocking response telling us "its not our problem" We had no other options but to start to arrange alternative accomodation. whilst sitting in the reception of this hotel we were approached by the receptionist once more who told us he may have something for us which meets our criteria. We went witht the male who took us to a wonderful place called the park lane hotel which was amazing but after he collected a key from the reception and told us to follow him down a residential street we knew that our luck was out of the window. We were shown to a flat with wet floors, wet walls, letters everywhere and which resembled an episode of how clean is your house this place was an absolute hole and was immediately turned down also. Whos knows what we would of caught staying in that place for an hour never mind whole night. This website should have an option to not rate this place as it doesnt even deserve a click of the mouse I hope you all read this before you go to this place as if you do go you will be terribly dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Stay away for this place”
Reviews.Author: Chris38732
Reviews.Content: 3 rooms were booked and confirmed, but the Pembury hotel manager had moved us into a single room with four beds. This was unacceptable as we were both male and female guests. This room was not even in the Pembury hotel, but in the next door Hotel which was under going a major rebuild and not fit for use. Pembury Hotel Staff would not call the duty manager (not very helpful at all), and informed me that this was not his problem as it was the manager who had moved us into this single room with the four beds. We were offered a single room for the lady in a different hotel somewhere in the area, splitting up our party of four, but I would have to pay for it, on top of the money already paid. With the help of booking agent and over the telephone, the hotel staff were told to sort this out. I was directed to an apartment that was part of the Park Hotel, which was behind the Pembury, and clearly belonging to the same people as the Pembury. Apartment is not the word to be used. This so called apartment was up a street that I would not walk down, alone on a dark night, it was in fact somebody house. I could not get in the front door with out a fair amount of pushing, due to the build up of letters and mail jamming the door. The carpet was soaking wet and the walls damp, in fact I put my hand on the wall and my fingers went into the plaster. There was mould all over the place, no fitting in the apartment, clearly this apartment was in a state of on going repair, you could not lock the doors and a total disgrace. Stay away, stay away We moved to another hotel for the night

Reviews.Title: “an absolute pig stye-”
Reviews.Author: pishiko
Reviews.Content: we went there and our room had been booked three times over to different people. When we arrived they offerted us alternataive accomodation - in someones house!!!!!!!!!!!! We were shown the rooms - mould everywhere - a definate health risk. Should be ashamed to call it a hotel - you wouldn't put a prisioner in there!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rank, rank, rank.”
Reviews.Author: Dairich
Reviews.Content: It didn't start off too well when the horrifically rude woman on reception found it a great inconvenience to stop her inain conversation about not wanting to do her job properly and check us in. This was at 5pm. The room wasnt ready. Then when we found there was no TV in the room we were told (without jest) to watch the Walls. A different room was offered which was an absolute disgrace, broken plugs, damp, dirty, bugs the list goes on. So back to the TVless room. On the surface it was clean but still there were bugs everywhere. No hint of any thing like an apology Avoid this place at all costs. Avoid

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT ENTER”
Reviews.Author: frp1002
Reviews.Content: This was the dirtiest, smelliest most unpleasant hotel that i have ever had the miss fortune to stay in. on arrival with our booking ticket we were rudely told that this was not enough that we needed the code of the broker that had booked the room as ' we might not do business with that broker any more' We phoned the Travel Republic helpline who never returned a call to us eventually we got hold of holiday brokers via there emergency no who could not have been more helpful the staff at the hotel were generally rude unpleasant and unhelpful. the room stank of smoke and the door was broken due to being kicked in at some point you could not get into the bathroom as the light shade had fallen behind the door. Once access was gained there was urine in the toilet. The shower came complete black and orange mould and was not used due to its filthy appearance. There were broken tiles on the wall that enhanced the tired run down look of the room The room had three beds very tired and broken furniture and inadequate curtains that could not be pulled because the bed was in the way. The bed lining may have been cleaned but were stained threadbare ripped and ready for the bin the actual duvet under the cover was filthy dark grey the only chair in the room was torn and threadbare, there were stains and marks on the ceiling and the carpet was dirty stained and downright disgusting just don't ever stay there. Due to the state of the place we were not brave enough to eat there.

Reviews.Title: “A half filthy run down dump with the most incredibly rude and obnoxious staff ever to grace the hospitality world.”
Reviews.Author: Steve-Stories
Reviews.Content: Speechless, absolutely speechless. Bugs. Mould. Broken plug sockets. Filthy shower. The list goes on and on, and the woman on reception, well........

Reviews.Title: “sooo friendly”
Reviews.Author: snazzyshazSheringham
Reviews.Content: this is undergoing works at present but if your only going to sleep there they finish at 5 so its ok the new rooms have everything you need and are basic but clean Thye do need to sort the tv out as i could only get one channel but the staff were very obliging and friendly it is minutes from the underground or arsenel stadium so for one or two nights i would certainly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Absoloutly Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: hippychick_11
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of friends had booked this hotel for somewhere cheap to stay on a night out in London. We knew from the price that the rooms would be basic, but was so appalled by what we found, we only stayed an hour before leaving! 3 of our party came home and found we had been bitten. On close inspection of the room, i found bugs crawling in the sink. The toilet had not been cleaned, and there were exposed wires hanging from plugs in the wall. The general cleanliness of the bathroom and bedroom surfaces were disgusting, there was no way any of us would have slept in these rooms. Security was also an issue, as even thought the hotel cannot be held accountable for the punchups occuring outside, the windows did not shut and lock properly and bars were loose. We just did not feel safe. All in all an awful experience. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Should be condemned!”
Reviews.Author: wattsrocks616
Reviews.Content: British Airways recommended this to us in a London weekend travel package. We stayed for less than 30 mins, in that time we had changed room, to an even filthier one, and been on the phone to BA customer services who moved us instantly to the Copthorne Tara Hotel in Kensington. BA have since refunded us and are investigating. Insects, mould, filth, permanent banging and drilling! You name it, this place has it! To top it off, the staff shouted at us when we said weren't satisfied, and I thought one particular girl was going to thump me as we left!

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: albibe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to cover a gap between moving flats - it was cheap and conveniently located. I had imagined that the standard would be fairly basic and wasn't expecting much, but it was actually a horrible experience. My room was dirty (dust in the corners, the curtains looked like they'd never been washed, sticky bathroom surfaces, an empty bottle of Vodka behind my bed), reaked of cigarette smoke (even the bathroom, yuck), the lock was so basic that anybody could have kicked it in, it was very loud at night with people shouting in the corridors and banging their doors. I didn't even try the breakfast; considering how dirty everything was I don't want to imagine what the kitchen looks like. The worst was that in the first night at 1am someone tried to enter my room, they had a key and said they were from reception but it still took me asking what they wanted for them to apologise and stop trying to enter!!! I was really freaked after this but when I mentioned the incidence at reception the next day I was just told that this was impossible and could not have happened, the guy didn't care at all. I was so glad when I could check out a night early - this is the worst hotel I ever staid at, do not waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pikey_kev
Reviews.Content: Foreign staff who struggle to understand simple English is quite annoying, very noisey hotel. The various rooms i stayed in were all poor and had a smell of damp. I had to leave 2 days early one week due to unforseen circumstances, i asked for a refund for the 2 nights i didn't stay- this was refused, after a bit of a rant by myself i managed to reclaim 1 night, the money was credited back to my debit card and i was handed a receipt saying 'refunded £45'....but suprise suprise Money never reach my account..... i rang the hotel and once again the language barrier just got in the way of the conversation!! The only thing i would say is it is the cheapest in the area, with work we only get a certain nightly allowance and the price was similar to this. Next time im working in the area i would rather be out of pocket than stay at the Pembury Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “we stayed at one of the sister hotels woodberry down hotel just down the road”
Reviews.Author: jamesanddenise
Reviews.Content: we stayed in your sister hotel just off the seven sisters road called the woodberry hotel number 6 woodberry down, my name is mr james darlaston i booked a double room with breakfast and stayed on the 22nd jan 2011 until the 23rd jan 2011, i have to say i have never stayed in such a terrible place, its advertised as a 5 minute walk from finsbury park tube station, the hotel is so hard to find local people have never even heard of your hotel which makes it worse to find, the bathroom was in a terrible state all bodged up around the toilet, the room was disgusting and the road noise outside was unbearable, the heating was permantly on and so hot it was making us ill and dizzy, i did complain but the bloke and the woman just smiled and didnt even apologise, we had a terrible stay at your hotel, we stayed because the owner said i was a 10 minute walk to the emirates stadium football ground, it takes just under half an hour to the ground not 10 minutes we are very annoyed at the false information given, the breakfast is lousy and we had to ask for everything, there was no milk laid out butter or anything, it was the worst place we have ever stayed in, we want refunding for our stay and have been advised by the hotel trading standards to try and resolve it with you first, if we are not compensated we will take this further and to court if we have to, its a terrible place to stay, and want compensating asap, we never had a wink of sleep due to the heat and noise it was over 100 degrees in the room and made us ill. let me know what you intend to do about this, we did complain but nobody wanted to know. mr james darlaston 43 ramsden avenue nuneaton warwickshire cv10 9eb the invoice receipt for our stay is number 42669

Reviews.Title: “worst night of our lives”
Reviews.Author: gooners19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here purely because of its proximity to the Emirates Stadium. That said this was the dirtiest ,grubbiest and least welcoming room we have ever stayed in and we have done cheap and cheerful all over the world. Fortunately it was only one night and if we could have found somewhere else in the middle of the night we would have, it was the longest 8 hours of our lives. Believe me when I say you are 99% certain to regret staying here, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT .....DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: helenPeterborough
Reviews.Content: I cannot tell you how bad this hotel is! Its dirty, its run down, its smelly, its mouldy, blood stains on the wall, carpets stink, other peoples hairs in the sink and shower. I could not even get in the shower, i travelled home for one. We were with friends and both rooms were DISGUSTING. We booked and paid in advance, big mistake and checked in late at night, another big mistake. We got out early without even bothering with the continental breakfast as god knows what the kitchens are like. DO NOT WASTE YOUR HARD EARNED CASH HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Service "I don't know nothing about" attitude”
Reviews.Author: frustratedman
Reviews.Content: I have made a booking for my friends and didn't realise that they had so much bad reviews. Easy Jet Lost My friends Luggage and delivered it Saturday 11/12/10, to Pembury Hotel Finsbury park. Reception didn't even bother to tell my friends, the luggage was there..... until the last day 13/12/2010, when they checked out, after I have made crazy phone calls to easy jet and courrier. And by the way!!! if you go there you might have to take some earplugs because there seem to be a lady down there who doesn't stop having sex. My friend go back today exausted and very disapointed like me. Not only the hotel London it's over rated I am so happy to leave this country for good. I FEEL SICK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: hydrojako
Reviews.Content: THis is the most dirty hotel I've ever been at. The furniture looked like it was taken from a garbage container. The smell was horrible in the rooms and the bathroom were so bad that i only walked in there with shooes on! left after 2 hours(the time it took to find a free room on another hotel on a saturday night in London). I can't belive this is called a hotel, it is only a shelter under roof!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare”
Reviews.Author: dorothea27us
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BOOK HERE!! We stayed in this shabby hotel for three horrible nights. Room was extremely small with little storage place. Bathroom and shower was ridiculously small, only hot to very hot water (no cold water at all) and completely worn out and dirty. Nothing in the bathroom to put your things, not even the soap and you're not able to even bend over in the shower, because it's too small. Two very dirty chairs in the room. A rickety cabinet with drawers that couldn't be opened. A very small window, which could not be opened. Ventilation opening in bathroom was completely filled with black dirt and dust, which meant a damp room day and night. The beds were not next to each other because the room was too narrow and of course there were no bedside tables. We just came in to sleep and rushed off every morning as soon as possible. Breakfast was served in the next-door hotel and was very disappointing: bread, cheese, ham and marmelade - all with no taste at all + Nescafé coffee. We had to pay in advance for our three nights (210 GBP) otherwise we would certainly have checked out after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “worst place I ever stay in my whole life.”
Reviews.Author: scecm
Reviews.Content: The girl at the reception seem to making a favour just to be there. Terrible unfriendlly and impolite. Extremely dirty carpet, all furniture almost broken. 4 days, didn't change sheets or towel or wash the spoon and cup in the room. First night, no hot water, than, second night I change room and no hot water again. Very bad breakfast. Had to wait to chek in. The location is not bad and the staff of the hotel where the breakfast is served are quite useful.

Reviews.Title: “not a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdempsey78
Reviews.Content: the bathroom was tiny and covered in mould. No hot water in shower or sink and sink was too small to have a wash in. Furniture was tatty and stained, beds were really hard - did not sleep at all. The room smalled of blocked drains and the inside of the drawers were dirty. Where did it get a 3 star rating from???

Reviews.Title: “Checked out after 2 hours!”
Reviews.Author: mla87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a terrible location. It feels vey unsafe and is definitely not suitable for families. Our taxi driver told us there are regularly prostitutes in the nearby park. The hotel itself is more than basic, barely livable. We checked out before the first night as we felt so unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 2 stars, more like errr.... minus star ...”
Reviews.Author: engam
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel errr more like hostel I have ever stayed. The university hostel I stayed in when I was a young lad was much better than this. It is depressing to even look at the room. extremely narrow corridor, worn out carpet, plastic teaspoons, and the noise make this a low standard acommodation - it deserves minus stars !!! There is a housing development next to the hotel. The earthwork has just begun and therefore construction is likely to last at least the next 6 months. The excavator and bulldozer noise is on going the whole day, even on a saturday. On the other side of the property there is renovation with constant banging noise. The room gets very hot and unairconditioned, not even a fan is provided. The shower room and toilet were very narrow. Housekeeping staff need more training to learn some manners. My bed linen were not changed for 6 days. Standard of cleanliness and bed making is terrible. I am charged 60 GBP a night for this dump - a very high price for a very low quality product/service.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly and noisy”
Reviews.Author: DenHague_resident
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 nights stay at this hotel. The only good thing is the clean bed sheets. Everything else is rubish. I can't imagine from where they got the 3 stars . It's very noisy as the doors close without a handle. People come and go in the midle of the night with noisy doors slam. Look elsewhere for another hotel. This is more like a hostel with a small tv .

Reviews.Title: “One star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Stockholm2009
Reviews.Content: Terrible! Although short distance to Finsbury Park station, the hotel standard was terrible. The hotel needs a great makeover this year. We found big holes under the carpet, the bathroomfloor was fixed with duct tape. Wouldn't ever recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “worlds worst”
Reviews.Author: denisandniamh
Reviews.Content: this must surely be worst hotel in london rooms were a kip breakfast was a joke you had to go out of building to another kip for your breakfast my advice run a hundred miles from this plase

Reviews.Title: “A lot better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Suzette08
Reviews.Content: I travel regually on business and this hotel was handy for its purpose so even after reading the reviews I booked it... It really wasn't bad, I stayed for 2 nights in a large, clean, warm, quiet room. Service from reception was fine. Breakfast filled a hole, toast, jams, cheese and ham... don't stay here if you want a full English! How could I complain after paying £40 per night bed and breakfast with free carparking! I would stay again when traveling to London.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: GarryLFC1990
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pembury for a late midweek match away at the Emirates. It looks okay from the front, nice views across the park and the location is about 10 minutes walk to the nearest Tube station. Me and my friend stayed in a twin room and but we had to go outside to another wing which looked like it used to be a B&B of some sort. First impressions were the room was incredibly small, had two single beds, a wardrobe and a chest of draws with very little walking space. There's a TV which was also tiny and had the channels mixed up and there was also a kettle there with tea bags, coffee, sugar etc etc. I never used it though, christ knows how long the milk might have been there! The beds were comfortable enough and i did sleep preety well. The bathroom was tiny but clean. The sink was a hand basin and the shower, even the smallest of people would have trouble standing under the jet, not good for a 6 footer! The worst thing about the bathroom was the cold tap ran hot so there was no cold water and also no warning. The 'cold' icon on top of the tap had been removed so it was impossible to even have a wash! Overall i'd say it's okay(ish) for a quick overnight stay but if you're planning on staying in London for a while then pay the extra for somewere better! I gave the service a 5 star rating because of the blonde on the reception who was gorgeous! :)

Reviews.Title: “Just horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Leisuretraveller2
Reviews.Content: Do not go to this hotel!! I stayed there for 5 nights and it was just a nightmare. The hotel is located very far from the center, and it's not so close to the underground station as well. Hotel is located alongside a very busy road, so there were a lot of noise. The worst part was the hotelroom. It was amazingly small. I don't usually mind small hotelrooms, but this one was just too small even for my taste. The room was also very unsafe. The door had just a tiny lock, that could have been easily broken. Even I could have been able to push that door down. So we were kinda scared to stay there, and had to hide our passports and other valuable things when we were out. The room was just not very useful, dirty, old and small. The bathroom was just as small and dirty. To breakfast you had to walk to another hotel. The hotel was just horrible.

Reviews.Title: “OK For One Night”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Sin_Kween
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a low-price hotel in the Finsbury Park area, and this hotel was just about OK. Rooms were small but comfortable and could be better maintained. The window fitting was broken (as was the toilet roll holder) and the isolation switch was filthy. In order to receive my 'free' breakfast I had to walk across the car park to the other wing; not great on a cold, wet November day! I was sure what to expect. Hot buffet? Continental buffet? Unfortunately it was the latter (sort of!). Ham, cheese, bread, cereal, and that's about it (plus drinks). Don't forget, you get what you pay for. I believe there is no bar at this property (certainly not at the Pembury Wing) but there are some pubs near Finsbury Park station, less than 5 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice next time”
Reviews.Author: Tisco031
Reviews.Content: If you´re going to see a late weekday match at the Emirates it´s OK, otherwise book another hotel. It looks nice from the outside so you get a little disappointed when you see the the room. However, our room actually was clean; beds, toilet, shower so I reallyc can´t complaint about that. It´s just that it doesn´t feel fresh. The whole place needs to be renowated. Some earlier guest probably had a bad day because he put att foot through the wall (picture). The volumeknob on the remote was stuck and it wasn´t possible to change the volume on the TV. The breakfast buffet in the hotel across the backyard was poor, just bread, marmelade, cheese, "orange juice" and the or coffee. But you could eat as much as you wanted. There are hundreds of hotels like this in London, better and worse. If you´re looking for one in the north near Emirates Stadium and the underground this is a good deal, otherwise not.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at the Pembury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abeke
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Pembury hotel located opposite Finsbury Park in north London. The room was small and tidy. The television was very small with the channels srambled. There were freeview channels; only the 5 terrestrial channels were available. The hotel house keepers were friendly and polite. The staff at the front desk could be friendlier and more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Misery”
Reviews.Author: King007Germany
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this place it is not worth it . You are paying way toooo more for what you are getting. The front end staff are very rude and they need training on customer service, they are not friendly and abnoxious. The rooms are a joke, if you like stinky, filthy bathrooms and unclean rooms then you are at the right place. No phone or hairdryers as advertized on the net.

Reviews.Title: “I beg you.... Do not stay here!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nanny123
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for a little budget holiday. when we arrived the man on reception was moody and seemed to take his time with our booking, when he did get round to it there was someone else staying in our room. we were given another room but as soom as he told us breakfast would be across the car park in another hotel alarm bells started ringing, we walked down the corridor and it was very thin and long, when we got to our room the whole door moved as we put the key in. in the room there was 2 foot waliking space around the bed and the bed was not made, it was very dark as the windows were minute, the lamp shades were stained yellow and the paint was flaking off the walls, the picture on the wall wouldnt even sit properly. there were shelves with a horrible stained curtain hiding them and the bathroom was discusting!!!!!!! the shower was 50cm squared with a broken curtain hangin down, the toielt was oppisite but you could barely fit in the space between the shower and toilet. me and my partner walked in and walked straight back out, you felt like you were going to have someone attaking you in your own room while you were sleeping. wouldnt want my worst enemy staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT use this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pastyman109
Reviews.Content: This place is probably the WORST hotel i've EVER stayed in. Mould in the bathroom,paint flaking off the ceiling and SMELLY. I will never recommend this hotel to anyone. I didn't even see the night out, I moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Seemingly much improved”
Reviews.Author: DaveWibble
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews, I would have to disagree with many points. For a budget hotel, this hotel was a pleasant surprise. The room was clean, with fresh towels daily, the bathroom was also clean with an excellent shower. The hotel itself was well presented, and seems to have benefited from some recent improvements (faint odour of fresh paint when we arrived). Breakfast was simple but plentiful and served over a good range of times. It's true, the surrounding area (Finsbury Park) was intimidating at first, but we neither had nor saw any trouble. The hotel staff, whilst not actually friendly or chatty were in no way unpleasant or impolite. Breakfast was quite plain (cereal, toast with butter, jam and/or cheese, tea, coffee, etc) but more than sufficient and in as much quantity as you wanted. If you want a pristine hotel with top class staff, cooked breakfasts and amazing surrounding area, then stay somewhere else, but you will pay for it. If you want a budget hotel with good transport into London then this hotel could fit the bill just right.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Radiolina
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for only one night (fortunately!) and it was horrible...The rooms towards the street are quite noisy, we woke up in the middle of the night because of a weird noise which turned out to be water dripping inside the room. Curtains were completely soaked and floor partially flooded. We changed room and got one without heating, which would have been necessary (outside temperature around 10°C, almost the same as inside!). The next morning I went to have a shower, but it fell apart the moment I touched it, so I had to hold the shower head all the time...Breakfast was the last disaster of the stay...it consisted of bread, and sliced cheddar, that's it! Some other items were displayed, such as yogurt, fruit, pastries, but you had to pay an extra for those...It's definitely a very bad hotel, don't book it, you'll only be deceived, and you can find hostels which have a much higher standard.

Reviews.Title: “you only get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: gmusafi
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two night stay at the Pembury Hotel.We were left withiut breakfast on the 16th November and we were not compensated in any way' we were just told that we would'nt be having any breakfast.The bed was not made and the toilet was so small you could barely fit in the room besides that the wash hand basin was dirty.The only good thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “"This hotel covers the whole meaning of RECESSION"”
Reviews.Author: dublinbond007
Reviews.Content: First things first this is possibly been the worst hotel ive ever stayed in EVER. The only reason why i stayed here is cause i was going to see the Emirates Cup & its only a 15min walk from the hotel but thats as good as it got. The sign outside the hotel looks posh but as you go inside its a dive. I had to change room 3 times as the first room had the next rooms toilet smells coming through to mine,then the second room i got the bed sheets had pubic hair on them & the bathroom had dirty towels thrown onto the floor & eventually the third room i got was slightly cleaner though the toilet was filthy & i never used the wash facilities once as grime was growing round the taps & the toilet was cracked at the bottom. the T.V. had no aerial so u couldnt watch that,the noise from outside of traffic was constant & music blearing all night was not a help either. the breakfast was not bad all the tea & toast you could eat but i'd never recommend this hotel to anyone my advice spend that bit extra its worth it trust me.

Reviews.Title: “What a Shambles”
Reviews.Author: beccysmiler
Reviews.Content: I knew something was not right with this booking when I called to see if the could answer a few queries before I departed on my trip, the response I got from the unfriendly girl at the other end of the line was 'I am very busy can you ring me back in ten minutes'!!! The stay itself was not bad but the staff could have looked like they actually wanted to be there, the room was ok but could have done with a bit of a decorate. The trouble came when I left a jumper in the room, realising my mistake I called the hotel the evening I got home. The guy who answered the phone didn't know what to do and asked me to call back in the morning. This I did but was asked if the next time I am passing could I pop in and collect it!.....Surely the point of a hotel is you GO AWAY to stay?! Having phoned several times and waiting for the manager to call me back, I had to ring and demand that they put the manager on the phone. Surely, a little bit of training and a little bit of effort from the staff this could have been a good little hotel to stay in for a few nights, but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Its filth,Dont Go There!”
Reviews.Author: lockester
Reviews.Content: Ive been to some hotels in my time but this was the worst of the worst by a mile!!! The room we were given was filthy.Stains,cracks,and paint peeling off ceiling. Walls were stained terribly and phone was cracked Bathroom tiles hanging off wall,shower head was brown,grime,mould and a foul stench filled this room. Toilet looked like it hadn't been cleaned for months. Trying to get to sleep was near on impossible.Music was coming from downstairs which shook the room and finished at 12:30am only when we made a compliant then to make matters even worse a group of men had a loud argument and skuffle at the hotel entrance at 4:15am!!!!!! Breakfast consisted of a trek across the carpark to have a choice of toast or cornflakes!!! We then went home a day early This is the first complaint i have ever made about a hotel as it was that bad I understand we all have different standards but you wouldn't put a pig in it!!!! Check out the photos.

Reviews.Title: “hellish hotel”
Reviews.Author: carina8
Reviews.Content: It was the worst hotel we ever stayed. The room was filthy. The bathroom was mouldy and smelly. It had ants. The hotel should be closed because it is a health hazard to sleep there. We prepaid to hotel club and was the end of our holiday. We were not able to find another place to stay due to a bank holiday weekend other hotels were full. I would not stay in this hotel ever again even if they pay me to stay. I guess the health standard in London are substandard. Otherwise a Pembury Hotel would be closed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels ever been to”
Reviews.Author: cjoton
Reviews.Content: It is one of the worst hotels I've ever been to. Apart from the fact that it was not very clean, and that the breakfast was just bread and cheese, we had a leak in our room at 3am, we had to have our room changed and they gave us a room with no heating that looked like a horror movie. It is cheap, but even if they paid me I would not return there.

HotelInfo.Name: Pembury Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 328 Seven Sisters Road | Finsbury Park, London N4 2AP, England
